column5: Part 2! Part 2! Part 2!
Gotta love that monster steelie right in front of Station Mall.  Excellent report as usual, dude!
Yessum.  Late July.  Still gotta solidify the dates but we'll make it happen.  yeeyyeeeeaaahh!!
Nice!let me know!

Hey OFC! It been a busy summer so far for me! Lots of fishing! I ended my steelhead season in the boat on the St. Marys. The first evening we were welcomed with a fish or double on every drift. I think by drift 7 we had 10+ fish in the boat.        Nice double!          Headed back out a few nights later and we hit a few fish but no numbers like the previous outing. Did land this big female...just shy of 32"     Next we tried an inland lake where we did well for walleye this winter. We started pulling spinners over tops of the weeds and quickly found ourselves hammering perch/panfish. Pulled out a slip bobber and had some fun for an hour or two. After we got tired of catching pannies we returned to searching for eyes... Stayed right til dark but came up empty handed. I Landed a few nice OOS smallie up to 20" and Ted landed this beautiful pike.    Next up was our trip up to Lake Nipigon! A full week of relaxing, eating and of course world class fishing. Fishing was awesome but there was times throughout the days where you had to work for them. Small spoons were hot at the start of our trip and jig flies were the ticket towards the end. Chuck from nipigon baits (OFC member) had sent me up some jig flies a few years ago. I decided to pop into his shop and he fixed me up again with some more dynamite jig flies. If your heading up to Nipigon hit him up! PM if you want more info....                    A great fish to start with...                          Casting the shorelines of islands 14km out into the lake! We watched this tank take my spoon boatside!                                            Fish/bacon sandwiches!              This laker took my jig fly a foot below the surface and went straight down!      Part 2 is much smaller and will be up very soon!   TDunn
All I can say is WOW!!!!
awesome fishing trip tyler !!!!   some very nice fish,man that looks so incredible up there...thanks for sharing
Simply amazing ! Shorter as it may be I can't wait for part 2
Very nice! Very, very, very, very, VERY nice!
Great pics!  Looks like an epic trip!
Awesome man. I can't wait for Part 2
Looks like a phenomenal trip ... whities , lakers and specs  Looked like a 6 oor 7 lb speck in one those pictures did you get a weight on it ?  congrats !!!!
WOW  I always love your reports!  Thanks for sharing.
Wow thats awesome, looks like your having a great year. Good stuff
We did have a scale but didn't use it. A few fish measured 22"+  thanks to all for the nice comments!   TDunn
Great report, some real nice fish!
Great photos but I absolutely love the one with the release tail slap !
Insane fishing!  Part II please
Just an incredible report Tyler. Brookies like those have been the fish of my dreams the last few years...I definitely have to make the trip up there soon.  Awesome fish!
Great report man, awesome fish. This is probably one of the coolest pics I've ever seen on this forum, you should send it to a few magazines or something    Gonna make it my background
Excellent pictures!  Looks like quite a trip. Nipigon always seemed like such a mystery to me.  What a beautiful place.
Nipigon is so SPECKtacular. Great shots  and some seriously nice fish. Thanks for sharing
AMAZING. Tyler.  Always look forward to your reports.  Nipigon specks, OH BABY!!!!!
Yep.  That squares it.  I'm putting you on hatecha.com!!  Sweet sweet fish porn there budday.  See you in July!

Right on man! PM me those dates... I'm outta town til the 15th. The day I get home from Oba I'm headed back on the road to south river to fish a bass tourny for two days in my kayak! hopefully your planning for late july?  let me know
Great pics.
That nipigon trip is just classic! So many good fish.  Thanks for posting, but your really making me hate work!
That's a heckuva cup of morning coffee right there!!!  Whoa!  Buzzed on specks in like seconds.  Great report Tyler.
Nothing short of awesome!!
